intro: Heliophytum glabriusculum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as thick cuticles and reduced leaf surface area to minimize water loss. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it blooms during the warmer months, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Heliophytum glabriusculum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
